concept_data.title: United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights
concept_data.preferred_term: UN High Commissioner for Human Rights

summary: The "UN High Commissioner for Human Rights" (often referred to as UN High Commissioner for Human Rights) is a pivotal figure within the United Nations framework, tasked with promoting and protecting human rights globally. In the context of EU legal and regulatory documents, the High Commissioner plays a crucial role in influencing EU human rights policies and ensuring compliance with international human rights standards. The EU frequently collaborates with the UN High Commissioner to address human rights violations and to enhance the legislative framework governing human rights within its member states. This relationship underscores the EU's commitment to uphold fundamental rights and freedoms as enshrined in its treaties.
